column4: Merck & Co to buy Idenix to boost hepatitis C drugs portfolio
column5: Merck & Co Inc MRK.N said Monday it would buy Idenix Pharmaceuticals Inc IDIX.O for $3.85 billion and plans to combine the two companies' most promising drugs to produce a faster  more effective cure for hepatitis C.

column4: UPDATE 3-Merck to buy Idenix to boost hepatitis C drugs portfolio

column4: Merck to buy Idenix for about $3.85 billion
column5: June 9 Merck & Co Inc said it would buy Idenix Pharmaceuticals Inc in a deal valued at about $3.85 billion to complement its hepatitis C portfolio.

column4: Morgan Stanley sells TransMontaigne to NGL as physical oil role shrinks
column5: Morgan Stanley MS.N is selling its controlling stake in oil storage and transport company TransMontaigne Inc TMG.UL to NGL Energy Partners LP NGL.N for $200 million  essentially ending its long run as the biggest physical oil trader on Wall Street.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Morgan Stanley sells TransMontaigne to NGL as physical oil role shrinks
column5: (Corrects headline to reflect that Morgan Stanley will continue to trade physical oil on a case-by-case basis; corrects description of TransMontaigne in first paragraph to "oil storage and transport company" from "pipeline company")

column4: Morgan Stanley to sell stake in TransMontaigne
column5: June 9 Morgan Stanley is selling its stake in oil pipeline company TransMontaigne Inc to NGL Energy Partners LP for $200 million  as the bank slims down its commodities business.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Morgan Stanley sells TransMontaigne to NGL as physical oil role shrinks

column4: Orange shares rise on Deutsche Telekom bid talk -traders
column5: LONDON Shares in French telecoms company Orange rose to a 2-1/2 year high on Monday  with traders citing talk of a possible bid from German rival Deutsche Telekom.

column4: UPDATE 1-Orange shares rise on Deutsche Telekom bid talk -traders
column5: LONDON  June 9 Shares in French telecoms company Orange rose to a 2-1/2 year high on Monday  with traders citing talk of a possible bid from German rival Deutsche Telekom.

column4: PetroChina plant revamp delay slows Saudi oil imports -sources
column5: BEIJING  June 9 Revamping a PetroChina  subsidiary refinery to process sour crude is taking months longer than expected  cutting the firm's crude oil purchases from Saudi Arabia  two industry sources said.

column4: PPL Pennsylvania Susquehanna 1 nuclear power reactor up to 82 pct
column5: June 9 PPL Corp's 1 260-megawatt Unit 1 at the Susquehanna nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania ramped up to 82 percent power by early Monday from 15 percent power early Thursday  the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission said in a report.

column4: BRIEF-Sasol  Ineos reach final investment decision on polyethylene JV
column5: * Sasol and Ineos reach final investment decision on high density polyethylene joint venture

column4: Soccer sponsors raise pressure on FIFA over Qatar claims
column5: LONDON/RIO DEIRO Sponsors Adidas  Sony  Visa and Coca-Cola on Sunday called on soccer's rulers to deal thoroughly with allegations of bribery to secure the 2022 World Cup for Qatar  an issue overshadowing this week's kickoff in Brazil.

column4: UPDATE 6-Soccer sponsors raise pressure on FIFA over Qatar claims
column5: * Allegations cloud build-up to Brazil tournament this week

column4: If Sprint buys T-Mobile  it may have to slash prices -analysts
column5: WASHINGTON  June 9 If Sprint Corp acquires T-Mobile US Inc  it  could save up to $6.6 billion on network  equipment and operating costs  but it will have to slash its prices to match the target company's steep discounts  analysts said on Monday.

column4: Telefonica prepares movie  TV series streaming service: source
column5: MADRID Spanish telecommunications company Telefonica is preparing to launch a video streaming service for movies and television series  a source close to the matter said on Monday.

column4: Telefonica prepares movie  TV series streaming service - source
column5: MADRID  June 9 Spanish telecommunications company Telefonica is preparing to launch a video streaming service for movies and television series  a source close to the matter said on Monday.

column4: Budnik to become CEO at Czech Telefonica from July -paper
column5: PRAGUE  June 9 Tomas Budnik will become chief executive officer at Czech Telefonica on July 1  replacing Luis Malvido  business daily Hospodarske Noviny reported on Monday.

column4: Time Warner in talks to buy stake in Vice Media: Sky News
column5: Time Warner Inc  is in talks to buy a major stake in Vice Media  valuing the media company at about $2.2 billion  Sky News reported  citing sources.

column4: Time Warner in talks to buy stake in Vice Media - Sky News
column5: June 9 Time Warner Inc is in talks to buy a major stake in Vice Media  valuing the media company at about $2.2 billion  Sky News reported  citing sources.

column4: Time Inc shares dip even as new CEO sees growth
column5: Shares of Time Inc ebbed on Monday in the magazine publisher's first trading session since its spinoff from Time Warner Inc  even as CEO Joe Ripp vowed to expand a business he said had been starved of capital for years.

column4: UPDATE 3-Time Inc shares dip even as new CEO sees growth
column5: June 9 Shares of Time Inc ebbed on Monday in the magazine publisher's first trading session since its spinoff from Time Warner Inc  even as CEO Joe Ripp vowed to expand a business he said had been starved of capital for years.

column4: As challenges for magazines persist  Time Inc begins anew
column5: June 9 Time Inc  the magazine company that is home to People  Sports Illustrated and Time  will begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange on Monday as print based companies face serious hurdles.

column4: Tyson wins bid for Hillshire in battle of meat titans
column5: Tyson Foods Inc  won the bidding war for Hillshire Brands Co  with an all-cash offer that values the maker of Jimmy Dean sausages at $8.55 billion and would be the biggest deal yet for the global meat business. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Tyson wins bid for Hillshire in battle of meat titans
column5: June 9 Tyson Foods Inc won the bidding war for Hillshire Brands Co with an all-cash offer that values the maker of Jimmy Dean sausages at $8.55 billion and would be the biggest deal yet for the global meat business.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St edges up  lifted by mergers  acquisitions

column4: Tyson Foods says wins bidding war for Hillshire Brands
column5: June 9 Tyson Foods Inc said it reached a "unilaterally binding offer" to buy Hillshire Brands Co  for $8.55 billion  including debt  beating out Pilgrim's Pride Corp for the maker of Jimmy Dean sausages.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures flat with indexes at records
column5: NEW YORK  June 9 U.S. stock index futures were little changed on Monday  as investors sought fresh incentives to keep buying following a rally that has taken major indexes to repeated record highs.

column4: Unilever CEO says Russia still land of opportunities
column5: MOSCOW Consumer goods maker Unilever   is keeping faith in Russia as an important growth market and is ready to plow money into factories and acquisitions there despite a slowing economy.

column4: UPDATE 4-Trucker in Tracy Morgan crash hadn't slept in 24 hours -court papers
column5: NEW YORK/NEW BRUNSWICK  N.J.  June 9 A Wal-Mart truck driver charged in the fatal New Jersey traffic accident that left comedian Tracy Morgan critically injured had not slept in more than 24 hours  according to a criminal complaint filed on Monday.

column4: Wal-Mart.com CEO Joel Anderson to step down
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc said Joel Anderson  chief executive of its United States website  Walmart.com  would step down  at a time the company plans to speed up investments in technology to boost sales at its fast-growing e-commerce business.

column4: Wal-Mart.com CEO Joel Anderson to step down
column5: June 9 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said Joel Anderson  chief executive of its United States website  Walmart.com  would step down  at a time the company plans to speed up investments in technology to boost sales at its fast-growing e-commerce business.

column4: Killers of Las Vegas cops harbored anti-government ideology
column5: LAS VEGAS A married couple who shot dead two Las Vegas police officers in a weekend pizza parlor ambush harbored anti-government and white supremacist ideology and threw a swastika on the body of one of the officers they gunned down  police said on Monday.

column4: Las Vegas cop killers may have white supremacy links: report
column5: LAS VEGAS Law enforcement officials are looking into whether a man and woman who killed two Las Vegas police officers and a third person before killing themselves Sunday had links to the white supremacy movement  according to a report on Monday.

column4: U.S. Supreme Court declines to hear Wells Fargo-IRS tax squabble
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court declined on Monday to hear an appeal from Wells Fargo & Co in a case involving a complex financial deal implemented by the banking group that the government said was set up solely to avoid millions of dollars in taxes.

column4: U.S. Supreme Court declines to hear Wells Fargo-IRS tax squabble
